com.thinkaurelius.titan.core

Interface TitanGraphTransaction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.KeyIndexableGraph, SchemaInspector, SchemaManager, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.TransactionalGraph
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TitanGraph, TitanTransaction
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardTitanGraph, StandardTitanTx, TitanBlueprintsGraph, TitanBlueprintsTransaction

    public interface TitanGraphTransaction
extends com.tinkerpop.blueprints.TransactionalGraph, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.KeyIndexableGraph, SchemaManager
    TitanGraphTransaction defines a transactional context for a TitanGraph. Since TitanGraph is a transactional graph database, all interactions with the graph are mitigated by a TitanGraphTransaction.

    All vertex and edge retrievals are channeled by a graph transaction which bundles all such retrievals, creations and deletions into one transaction. A graph transaction is analogous to a database transaction. The isolation level and ACID support are configured through the storage backend, meaning whatever level of isolation is supported by the storage backend is mirrored by a graph transaction.

    A graph transaction supports:

    • Creating vertices, properties and edges
    • Creating types
    • Index-based retrieval of vertices
    • Querying edges and vertices
    • Aborting and committing transaction
    Author:
    Matthias Bröcheler (http://www.matthiasb.com)

      • getVertices

        Map<Long,TitanVertex> getVertices(long... ids)
        Retrieves the vertices for the given ids and returns a map from those ids to the corresponding vertices. If a given id does not identify a vertex, it is not included in the returned map
        Parameters:
        ids - array of ids for which to retrieve vertices
        Returns:
        map from ids to corresponding vertices does not identify a vertex

      • indexQuery

        TitanIndexQuery indexQuery(String indexName,
                         String query)
        Returns a TitanIndexQuery to query for vertices or edges against the specified indexing backend using the given query string. The query string is analyzed and answered by the underlying storage backend.

        Note, that using indexQuery will may ignore modifications in the current transaction.

        Parameters:
        indexName - Name of the indexing backend to query as configured
        query - Query string
        Returns:
        TitanIndexQuery object to query the index directly
